metadata.title: CVE-2019-16892 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In Rubyzip before 1.3.0, a crafted ZIP file can bypass application checkson ZIP entry sizes because data about the uncompressed size can be spoofed.This allows attackers to cause a denial of service (disk consumption).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16892` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ruby-zip - 2.0.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-zip package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.0-2').
